zfd_croatian: olsteeodi. ostodi. osthedi. osti. eei. osteodar. osteosti. otreodi. otro. otrol. otreei. ar. istooar. ain. aesteei. osteosteosteodi. osteodar. hi. s. ain. otrosteoar. or. ar. al. otrol. al. shshstei. otreeeodar. otreodi. otrol. ain. shoestei. sal. al. ald. heeosteo. korsti. holi
english_gloss: Outer ring: 38 words dominated by ok(ost) and ot(otr) prefixes. Recurring morphemes: ost- (bone), otr- (vessel/treated), ar (water/agent), al (substance), ain (substance), sal (salt), or (oil), ol (oil). Several words with uncertainty marks (!). Pharmaceutical glosses applied mechanically; zodiac-specific meaning uncertain.
confidence_notes: Circular text with multiple uncertain readings. 38 words, many with D-confidence individual readings. Overall interpretation unclear in zodiac context. No validated anchor words.

eva_divergences.reason: sh operator + ckh bench gallows = sh + hst; unusual doubled sh cluster

illustrations: Outermost text ring of circular zodiac diagram
uncertain_readings: okeo!keo!keody: three uncertain k readings; possibly not a single word
shckhey: unusual sh+ckh cluster produces awkward 'shshstei'

confidence_notes: Two-part label. ot(otr) operator clear; 'arar' (doubled -ar suffix) is unusual. Zodiac nymph name or positional marker.
illustrations: Label for outer band nymph at 10:30 position

confidence_notes: Unusual consonant cluster -stld-. ok(ost) operator applied but resulting morphology is opaque. The -am suffix suggests instrumental case.
illustrations: Label for outer band nymph at 11:00 position
uncertain_readings: Consonant cluster 'stld' is unusual in Croatian; possibly misread or different parse needed

confidence_notes: ot(otr) operator + vowels + al (substance) + d + y(i). Morphologically plausible but semantics unclear in zodiac context.
illustrations: Label for outer band nymph at 00:15 position (top of circle)

confidence_notes: ot(otr) + e + ol (oil) + ar (agent/water). Clear morpheme boundaries; ol and ar are confirmed stems.
illustrations: Label for outer band nymph at 01:15 position

confidence_notes: ok(ost) operator + e + o + al (substance) + y(i). Similar structure to L4 but with ost- instead of otr- prefix.
illustrations: Label for outer band nymph at 02:15 position

confidence_notes: ot(otr) + al (substance) + e + k(st, bone) + y(i). Contains both otr- and -st- morphemes.
illustrations: Label for outer band nymph at 03:15 position

confidence_notes: ot(otr) + al (substance) + s + ar (agent/water). Contains sal/sar (salt) morpheme. If zodiac labels can reference preparations, this could indicate a salt-related process.
illustrations: Label for outer band nymph at 05:00 position

confidence_notes: ch(h, cook) + sar (salt) + y(i, adj). Clear morpheme boundaries. The only outer label not beginning with ot/ok. Pharmaceutical gloss: cooked salt.
illustrations: Label for outer band nymph at 06:15 position

confidence_notes: Two-part label. First part: ot(otr) + e + o + t(tr, uncertain !) + e + y(i). Second part: sar (salt) + y(i). The uncertain t-gallows in the first part.

eva_divergences.reason: Uncertain medial t-gallows = -tr- if read correctly

illustrations: Label for outer band nymph at 07:30 position
uncertain_readings: The ! before t indicates transcriber uncertainty about the gallows character

confidence_notes: ot(otr) + al + al + y(i). Doubled -al- suffix is unusual. May indicate emphasis or a compound term.
illustrations: Label for outer band nymph at 09:00 position

zfd_croatian: otreodi. otreos. ohstei. otreesaei. lsheotrei. ostalodi. shs. shei. otreei. otrehar. hestal. ostodi. eeedi. otreodal. ostol. lsthol. dain. osteeees. istees. al. osthi. otrei. otreoshali ... o
english_gloss: Middle ring: 23+ words. Notable: word 15 '!!okol' = 'ostol' (bone-oil, same as f88r validated label, but with double uncertainty marks). Word 17 'dain' (give-substance) is a confirmed pharmaceutical term. Mix of ost- and otr- prefixed words. Gap near end of ring.
confidence_notes: Middle ring with 23 readable words plus a gap. Multiple uncertainty marks in EVA. Word '!!okol' could be the validated 'ostol' but double-! cautions against certainty. 'dain' is confirmed vocabulary.

eva_divergences.reason: Gallows k = st, ch = h in medial position

illustrations: Middle text ring between outer and inner nymph bands
uncertain_readings: lsheotey: 'l' initial is not a standard operator

confidence_notes: Two-part label. First part: ot(otr) + ol (oil) = 'otrol'. Second part: ch(h) + d + y(i) = 'hdi'. The second part is very short and morphologically terse.
illustrations: Label for inner band nymph at 11:00 position
uncertain_readings: 'hdi' is very short; morphological interpretation uncertain

confidence_notes: Longest inner band label. ot(otr) + ol (oil) + o + ar (water/agent) + am (instrumental). Multiple suffixes chained; morphologically complex.
illustrations: Label for inner band nymph at 01:15 position
uncertain_readings: Long compound label; multiple parse options for internal morpheme boundaries

confidence_notes: ot(otr) + ee + ol (oil). Short, clean label. The 'ee' may be an intensifier or connective vowel.
illustrations: Label for inner band nymph at 03:15 position

confidence_notes: ot(otr) + ol (oil) + ch(h, cook) + d (completion?). No final vowel or suffix -- ends on consonant 'd'. Unusual termination.
illustrations: Label for inner band nymph at 06:15 position
uncertain_readings: Ends on consonant 'd' with no suffix; unusual for Voynich word structure

confidence_notes: Two-part label. 'otral' = ot(otr) + al (substance). 'dar' = d + ar (give-agent). 'dar' is a confirmed pharmaceutical term (give/administer) seen in f88r.
illustrations: Label for inner band nymph at 09:00 position

zfd_croatian: otreeol. otral. hs. har. hesti. hetrshi. osteeodi. otreei. hesteen. osteol
english_gloss: Inner ring: 10 words. Higher proportion of ch(h) operator words (4/10) than other rings. 'osteol' (word 10) = bone-oil, close to validated 'ostol'. 'hetrshi' (word 6) combines cook+treat+soak operators. Mix of ost- and otr- prefixes with cooking/processing vocabulary.
confidence_notes: Inner ring with 10 words. No uncertainty marks in EVA. More ch(h) operator words suggest cooking/combining processes. 'osteol' is a near-match for validated 'ostol'. Morphological parsing is consistent.
illustrations: Innermost text ring of circular zodiac diagram
uncertain_readings: hs (word 3): very short, minimal morphological content
